alert.note: Alert for Antelope; Knox (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 23 at 10:46PM CDT until June 24 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN ANTELOPE AND SOUTHWESTERN KNOX COUNTIES... At 1046 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 3 miles northwest of Orchard, or 19 miles east of O`neill, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Antelope and southwestern Knox Counties, including the following locations... Ashfall Fossil Beds State Historical Park, The Highway 14 And 59 Junction and Grove Lake Recreation Area. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
